intro: Hedypnois polymorpha var. glabra, commonly known as the smooth hedypnois, is a rare and delicate plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, elliptical leaves that are smooth and glabrous. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
